Comment: The King's Gambit. There are many ways to continue, but one enduring theme is the threat to bring a Rook to f1 to participate quickly in the attack on the Black King. Black can accept the pawn, but must defend well.

Showing that Black's last was a waste of a move - an unaffordable luxury in the King's Gambit. Now when Black recaptures White can follow up with 8. Nc3 forking two unprotected pawns, and meanwhile is well ahead on development.

Oops.
Now Black is unable both to recapture the White Bishop and save her own. She chooses to save her own, but...

White now has the kind of attacking setup that he normally has to sacrifice a piece for in the King's Gambit. Instead he is a pawn ahead! There are many threats of discovered attacks on the f-file, the Black Knight is gone and the Bishop is stranded on the other side of the board.
